info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN WARREN, SOUTHERN CLARK, GREENE AND SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 347 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Kettering, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, nickel size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Springfield, Kettering, Beavercreek, Huber Heights, Fairborn, Xenia, Miamisburg, Springboro, Franklin, Bellbrook, Moraine, Carlisle, Oakwood, Yellow Springs, Wright-Patterson Afb, West Carrollton, Cedarville, Enon and Jamestown. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 41 and 61. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 37 and 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southwestern and west central Ohio. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
